profile.rationale: The job ad heavily emphasizes traditional software engineering tasks (designing, developing, integrating, maintaining scalable services, best practices in code, architecture, leading projects) which fall under Macro-Category A. It also requires specific knowledge and application of Generative AI concepts (Macro-Category B). The balance of extensive software engineering experience with a focus on applying GenAI capabilities, along with the mention of GenAI-specific tools like LangChain, points towards a 'Core GenAI Engineer' profile. The role is not purely focused on model development (Specialist) nor is it just integrating AI into existing products without building the AI services themselves (AI-Adjacent). It's about building the foundational GenAI services.

confidence.reasoning: The job advertisement is very clear and detailed, explicitly outlining responsibilities and requirements that align well with the defined profiles. The distinction between core software engineering and GenAI specialization is well-articulated, making the classification straightforward.
